description: Long bed, custom cab, well kept, same owner since 1974, good solid body, nice slick paint, good orig int, big block v8, auto, ps, pb, fact under dash a/c, old school aluminum slots, sharp truck, runs/drives good

GR Auto Gallery is pleased to present this 1966 F-100 4x4 Pickup.  It is a treat to see one of these old pick-ups in such tremendously great shape as they were notoriously beaten up on farms and construction sites. This retired work horse is powered by its 352 v8 paired to a manual transmission.  The truck runs and handles like a dream.  We took the truck on a road trip and were very happy with the results.

This '66 is equipped with a Chelsea PTO and a Braden winch, Warn manual locking hubs.  The truck has new carpet, Eagle Alloy wheels, rhino-lined inside of the bed, Holley carburetor, Goodyear Wrangler tires, cargo area inside the side of the bed, dual exhaust, tow receiver, and more.  The truck comes with the original owner warranty card, owner's manual and service specifications booklet as well.  The paint is in excellent condition and presents very well.  The headliner and seat remain in excellent condition as well.
These trucks are a very desirable body style in the classic world today representing the legendary work horses.  This truck is ready for its next owner.

Gr Auto Gallery, LLC and our sister company, Wheelz Sales and Leasing Inc. makes every effort to represent each vehicle accurately and with integrity. We also welcome third party inspections when necessary. Although we try to do our very best to be accurate in our description writing we are human and do make mistakes. Unless otherwise noted, All vehicles are sold AS IS, No Warranty Expressed or Implied. All sales final.

Available for purchase is this awesome 1958 F100 stepside pickup WITH side spare tire mount (pretty rare option on these VERY hard to find)  This truck runs great and the brakes work perfectly.  The clutch is slipping but we will replace it prior to sale.  The radiator has an old repair on the top of it but it does not appear to leak.  Someone has place a steel plate in the bed but the parts for the wood bed ar all still there although the wood is shot.  The tires have a lot of tread but are weather checked.  There have been some repairs to the running boards but they will need to be redone to be perfect.  The body is very solid with very few rust places.  One cab corner was fixed at one point and is starting to crack so it will need to be redone.  The interior was redone at some point and is still is really good condition.This truck is a very easy restore or restomod, and I will try to sell it for a couple of weeks then ZI will begin the restoration at which time the price will go WAY up.   58 F 100 stepsides have become very hard to find and almost impossible to find in good condition.  I have taken  many pictures of the weak or damaged areas.  If you want a truck to do an easy restore on this is the one for you.  No trades on this one.  We can help arrange shipping in the US.  We are a licensed and bonded Arkansas Used Vehicle dealer  (479) 252-6241

This Cruisin Classics listing is for ANYBODY looking for exactly this or for those that don't know what classic to choose with so many to choose from. You have to admire this 1973 Ford F100 Ranger XLT with the H code, 390 cubic inch, 2v engine. This beautiful short bed has all of the trim options including chrome front and rear bumpers. The fit and finish is respectively straight and excellent. To top it all off, it is an automatic with power steering, power brakes and factory A/C.

The good continues inside where you will find a red interior featuring a red bench, red cloth headliner, red door panels and carpet all accented by black. The music you hear is not only the car itself, it can also be from an in-dash JVC Am/Fm Stereo with a CD Player. Inside also you will find a factory A/C Unit that blows cold.

The very clean engine compartment that boasts the 390 (7L 10, Nov. 10, 1967) is also accompanied with a 2bbl carb., Cast factory intake manifold, Cast heads, and electronic ignition. You will also find the tire jack conveniently located on the inner fender well.
The sound of this truck is amazing which is caused by dual Flowmaster exhaust. The Automatic transmission is a Ford C6 (suffix PBG AG D5TP V) (1973).
Rear End...Ford 9 ('73) w/3.25 gears
Stock Suspension.
Power front disk brakes, drums rear.
American Racing wheels (15X7) on all 4's surrounded by Michelin (225/75-15's)

1970 Ford F100. FE 390, only 750 miles since complete rebuild. Forged flat top pistons. Reconditioned rods w/ ARP bolts. Isky Cam, hydraulic lifters, hardened push rods, rocker arms and timing set. Melling oil pump, screen and driveshaft. ARP engine bolt kit. Milodon oil pan. 69' 428 Cobra Jet heads, reconditioned. Chrome-Moly rocker arm shafts, Billet rocker arm stands and end supports. Brad Penn Grade 1 motor oil since rebuild. Holley carb and fuel pump. New Edelbrock Performer RPM intake. New steel braided fuel lines. 70' Mustang fuel tank mounted between frame rails. Electronic MSD Ignition module, coil and distributor w/new cap and rotor. New MSD 8.5mm Super Conductor wires w/heat sleeves. Frostbite 3 core radiator. Derale HO dual fans and shroud. Be Cool fan controller. 180 high flow thermostat, high volume water pump. Dougs headers, custom 3" exhaust w/ Hooker max flow mufflers. Complete re wire of truck using Ron Francis kit. C6 trans w/ shift kit. Heavy duty aluminum pan. Hughes Performance 2500 stall converter. New driveshaft and U-joints. DJM lowering suspension.  Moog heavy front coil springs, new shocks. New brass king pins. All new tie rods/rod ends. Front disc brake conversion, all new brake lines, master cylinder and proportioning valve. New custom interior. Dynaliner on floor, Pro Car Sporstman racing seats w/ 4pt harness, center console, new rubber floor mat, floor mounted shifter and Grant steering wheel.  All new electric gauges and Joes Racing switch panel. New tires, front and rear.  Cut out wheel tubs to fit 29X15 MT Sportsman tires. Custom backspace rear wheels. 95% of parts listed are new!  Many more things to list, please call or email for more specific details.

Interior Color: Black & Red with Corinthian White Trim Vinyl
'85 Dodge RAM W-150 Powertrain AM/FM Stereo Radio
Recent Full Restoration

In the coming years, you're going to be seeing a lot more trucks like this 1963 Ford F-100 showing up at events. The reason is that these kinds of vehicles represent an easy way to have V8 power and four-wheel-drive, not to mention a significant part of automotive history, all for a very affordable price. But they're scarce, so good ones like this will not be common without big injections of cash, so perhaps now is the time to buy.

With a paint job that matches the style, this Raven Black and Corinthian White pickup has a quality old-school look that's both attractive and rugged. It's not full of metallic like modern paint, so it has an authenticity that many restorations lack, and while there's some age and use on it, it will still grab everyone's attention out on the road. Perhaps it worked for a living in the past, but judging by the overall look, it has probably been a favorite hobby vehicle for many years, getting regular baths and wax jobs on weekends. Panel gaps are good and the seams line up well, and all the chrome and stainless trim is in bright condition. The bed has a well-protected wood finish that will look good for years

Ford has always had quality powertrains but this truck has been fitted with a 1985 Dodge Ram W-150 powertrain. The 5.2L 318ci V8 matched with the 3-speed automatic and four-wheel drive helps to make this truck a workhorse year-round.
Our team tested all of the mechanicals and test drove this truck and found no issues. The F100 drives and looks show quality.
Call or email us with any questions!
